articles.description: — Anthony Edwards had 23 points, 10 rebounds and five assists, Karl-Anthony Towns scored 20 points, and the Western Conference-leading Minnesota Timberwolves beat the New York Knicks 117-100 on Monday night.
articles.headline: Timberwolves stay atop West, undefeated at home as Edwards, Towns shine in 117-100 win over Knicks

images.name: Anthony Edwards elevates for the putback slam
images.caption: Anthony Edwards races down the court and finishes strong at the rim with a nice dunk vs. New York.

articles.description: — Bam Adebayo scored 23 points and had 11 rebounds, and the Miami Heat blew out the Chicago Bulls 118-100 on Monday night, two nights after blowing a 21-point...
articles.headline: Bam Adebayo scores 23 points as the Heat cruise to a 118-100 win over the Bulls

images.name: Jimmy Butler yells 'Skyhook!' and converts
images.caption: Jimmy Butler gets into the lane and calls his shot against the Bulls.

articles.description: — Brandon Ingram hit all five of his 3-pointers and led all scorers with 31 points, and Zion Williamson dominated the paint by scoring 26 points on 12-for-16 shooting to power the New Orleans Pelicans to a 129-93 victory over the Sacramento Kings on...
articles.headline: Ingram, Williamson power the Pelicans to a 129-93 win over Pacific Division-leading Kings

articles.description: — Paul George scored 28 points, Kawhi Leonard added 21 and the Los Angeles Clippers rolled past Victor Wembanyama and San Antonio 124-99 on Monday night, extending the Spurs’ losing streak to nine games.
articles.headline: George, Leonard lead Clippers past Spurs 124-99, extending San Antonio's skid to 9 straight

articles.description: — Miles Bridges made the most of his first NBA start in 586 days.
articles.headline: Miles Bridges' 3-pointer with 6.6 seconds left in OT helps Hornets beat Celtics; Tatum scores 45

images.name: Jayson Tatum misses crucial free-throw for Celtics in OT thriller
images.caption: Jayson Tatum misses a free-throw at the goal line, costing the Celtics a chance to defeat the Hornets in OT.

images.caption: James Harden heaves a nearly full-court dime to Kawhi Leonard who drains an impressive and-1 to pad the Clippers' lead.

articles.description: — Reggie Jackson scored 21 points and carried Denver in the fourth quarter after two-time MVP Nikola Jokic was ejected in the first half, and the Nuggets handed the Detroit Pistons their 12th straight loss, 107-103 on Monday night.
articles.headline: Reggie Jackson leads Nuggets past Pistons for 107-103 win after Nikola Jokic ejected
